addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight
Prin
cipall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

17 Ja
n
1588
From M
r
Bo
dley
fears menaced wold sometimes be executed.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. howe all hath heere procee-
ded between my
L. Generall
and
e
states
, concerning
e charge he receaved, for
e drawing out of certaine com
panies out of
Bergh
and
Ostend,
I thinke his L will
advertise. They are mervelously netled, uppon her
Ma
ties
writing in
at behalf. For they make account
that those townes are not defensive, W
t
the compa-
nies remaining. If they were not too muche wedded
to their self resoluc
o
ns, they would seeke to content
her Ma
tie
in some degree, though not happely so tho-
rowly nor w
t
so many companies, as her High
nes
doth
require. But as a man may easely finde both by
their speeches and proceedinges, they stand in opinio
n
that her Ma
ties
forces are sent hither, more for her
owne safetie, then for theirs. Whiche conceat of
theirs is rather c
o
firmed then otherwise, by rea
son
of her often Protestations to forsake them, if they
shall not yeld to some petitions, and yet in
e end
nothing put in execution. That they might finde
a difference betweene her Ma
tie
pleased and dis-
pleased, Under humble correction, I could wishe
they were never putt in feare, but when somwhat
should folowe, lest they fall to contempt: whiche
I am bold to signifie thus, Uppon
e c
o
fidence
at
I repose in yo
r
H. good acceptation of whatsoever
I shall write, doing all for
e best. At
M
r
Killigrewes
handes I have receaved exceeding
great kindnes, aswell for the furtherance of her
Ma
ties
service, as otherwise: for w
ch
I am to crave
yo
r
H favo
r
in geving him thankes in my behalf.
And so I take my humble leave. Ja
n
17. 88
Hage
Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
